I assume you never read the Code of JUnit ?
Reach for the following URL :
http://sourceforge.net/projects/junit
Select the CVS entry in the menu & then access in the middle of the 
page on the right handside the "Browse CVS Repository", to access the 
following URL : http://cvs.sourceforge.net/cgi-bin/viewcvs.cgi/junit/
If you look at the Assert::assertEquals (...) code you will see that 
the various implementation are rather OK.

The bottom line of this is that YOU need to provide an implemetation 
for the equals method...

Thomas,









--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "kartikdg" <kartik_dinakar@s...> wrote:
> Hi,
> I would like to deep compare 2 objects (expectedResult and 
> actualResult)
> using JUnit.
> 
> JUnit provides an interface called assertEquals(Object o1, Object 
o2) 
> which compares 2 obects by reference and does not perform a deep 
> comparison.
> 
> Since the expectedResult and actualResult will never have the same
> reference, does anyone have any idea on how to perform a deep 
> comparison comparing the values of 2 objects) ?
> 
> Cheers
> Kartik
